result.execSummary:
The defendant Thomas Edward Kinyon was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).
  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Maintain employment.  Not to terminate his employment without his agent's prior approval.

If agent recommends, defendant must attend and successfully complete an alcohol assessment and comply with any recommended treatment.  Defendant is to execute any releases necessary for agent to verify compliance.  If already done, continue to treat until his agent deems it no longer necessary

Defendant to be subject to random testing by his agent.

If agent recommends, defendant must attend and successfully complete an alcohol assessment and comply with any recommended treatment.  Defendant is to execute any releases necessary for agent to verify compliance.   If already done, continue to treat until his agent deems it no longer necessary

Defendant to be subject to random testing by his agent.

Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion.

Defendant shall have no contact, directly or indirectly, either personally, by mail, telephone or through any other person, or by any other means with Lucas Skaar.
May apply for expungement if he successfully completes probation.

The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by a risk and needs assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.

records.addlTxt: Associated with Charge #1

Sentencing on count 1.  Joint recommendation for 3 years probation.  Concurrent.  The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by a risk and needs assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.     Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion.  AODA and recommended treatment. If already done, continue to treat until his agent deems it no longer necessary.  May apply for expungement if he successfully completes probation.  No contact with L. S.  CC.    Maintain employment.  Not to terminate without his agent's prior approval.   Subject to random testing by his agent.
Sentencing hearing on April 3, 2017 at 10:00 am.

DA Gerald Fox appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in person, in custody, with Attorney Terrien.  Diversion agreement not at issue today.  Only sentencing after revocation.  Stipulation to revoke the diversion agreement.  Counts 2 and 3 addressed today.  Not a victim case.  Unpaid court ordered financial obligations.  Parties have the revocation packet.  Credit 4 additional days from paperwork.  Stipulated to.  State recommended:  Count 2- 3-6 months.  Count 3- 30 days concurrent to count 2.    Defense recommended:  Time served.  128 days.  

Court ordered:  Judgment for unpaid court ordered financial obligations.  Court ordered time served.  Count 2- 6 months.   Count 3 -30 days concurrent.  Credit for 128 days.
sent ROAW to Judge Becker.  JMM
Sentencing hearing on revocation on February 21, 2017 at 04:00 pm.
from DOC
ADA Melissa Inlow appeared for the State.  Attorney Sebion appeared for Attorney Terrien. Defendant is in Jackson County Jail.  Asking for STC- 1/23 at 3 pm.
to revoke felony diversion agreement
DNA submission form

Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion.

Defendant plead guilty to each of the charges contained in the information.  Court recited the charge and possible penalties on the count he plead to.  Defendant understood.  Diversion agreement filed for Count 1.  Court questioned the defendant on his understanding of the diversion agreement.  He stated he understood the agreement and can comply with the conditions.  Felony warnings given.  He also understood those warnings.  Court reviewed the plea questionnaire, constitutional rights and elements with the defendant.  Defense stipulated that there is a factual basis for the pleas.   Court found that the defendant freely, voluntarily, knowingly and intelligently entered his pleas and waived his constitutional rights.  Court found that a factual basis exists for the pleas.  Found guilty of Obstructing an Officer, contrary to 946.41(1) and Possession of drug paraphernalia, contrary to 961.573(1).  No finding on Count 1.  Joint recommendation for 2 years probation.    Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion.    The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by a risk and needs assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.      Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, the bar areas of restaurants. Defendant may not possess or consume any alcohol, nor be anywhere alcohol is available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.  

Court ordered:  sentence withheld, 2 years probation on the misdemeanor counts. AODA and recommended treatment.  Maintain employment.  Not to terminate without agents prior approval.  Agent to determine amount of employment, if he attends school.   Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion.    The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by a risk and needs assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.  CC.  Court advised defendant of the DNA submission requirement.    May apply for expungement if he successfully completes probation and the diversion agreement.  Diversion agreement approved for Count 1.  Speeding citation dismissed.
Reading of information waived.

DA Gerald Fox appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Jon Sherman.   Court questioned defendant on his understanding of the waiver of preliminary hearing.  He stated he understood.  Court found that the defendant knowingly and intelligently waived his right to have a preliminary hearing.
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 16, 2016 at 10:00 am.
ADA Melissa Inlow appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Sherman.  Close to an agreement.  Set for plea/sentencing, after May 9th.
Defendant was in and stated he paid attorney Sherman a retainer and no longer wants a court appointed attorney.
Defendant's

Pre-trial conference at 03-16-2016 10:00 am.
Status conference at 04-04-2016 03:00 pm.

Court questioned the defendant on his understanding of the waiver of time limits.  He stated he understood.  Court found that the defendant knowingly and intelligently waived the time limit for holding the preliminary hearing.

records.addlTxt: Defendant shall not consume any alcohol unless a physician states in writing that the defendant is alcohol dependent and complete withdrawal could endanger the defendant's health or life. In this case a doctor's excuse must be submitted to the Jackson County Clerk of Court or the Jackson County Jail within 48 hours of the bond being signed. Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, bar areas of restaurants, or where available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.  Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion.
SPD Eligibility Worksheet - not eligible

DA Gerald Fox appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared by video from the Jackson County Jail.  No counsel present.  Court recited the charge and possible penalties contained in the complaint.  Defendant understood.  Court advised the defendant to contact SPD for representation.  Bond set.  AIA set for 2/22/16 at 9 am.
Adjourned initial appearance at 02-22-2016 09:00 am

Defendant shall not consume any alcohol unless a physician states in writing that the defendant is alcohol dependent and complete withdrawal could endanger the defendant's health or life. In this case a doctor's excuse must be submitted to the Jackson County Clerk of Court or the Jackson County Jail within 48 hours of the bond being signed. Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, bar areas of restaurants, or where available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.  Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion.
